sourcePort.description: the port on which the packet will be sent

sourceChannel.description: the channel by which the packet will be sent

receiver.description: the recipient address on the destination chain

timeoutHeight.description: Timeout height relative to the current block height. If you are sending with IBC v1 protocol, either timeout_height or timeout_timestamp must be set. If you are sending with IBC v2 protocol, timeout_timestamp must be set, and timeout_height must be omitted.

timeoutTimestamp.description: Timeout timestamp in absolute nanoseconds since unix epoch. If you are sending with IBC v1 protocol, either timeout_height or timeout_timestamp must be set. If you are sending with IBC v2 protocol, timeout_timestamp must be set.

useAliasing.description: boolean flag to indicate if the transfer message is sent with the IBC v2 protocol but uses v1 channel identifiers. In this case, the v1 channel identifiers function as aliases to the underlying client ids. This only needs to be set if the channel IDs are V1 channel identifiers.

MsgTransfer.title: Msg Transfer
MsgTransfer.description: MsgTransfer defines a msg to transfer fungible tokens (i.e Coins) between ICS20 enabled chains. See ICS Spec here: https://github.com/cosmos/ibc/tree/master/spec/app/ics-020-fungible-token-transfer#data-structures

cosmos.base.v1beta1.Coin.title: Coin
cosmos.base.v1beta1.Coin.description: Coin defines a token with a denomination and an amount. NOTE: The amount field is an Int which implements the custom method signatures required by gogoproto.

revisionNumber.description: the revision that the client is currently on

revisionHeight.description: the height within the given revision

ibc.core.client.v1.Height.title: Height
ibc.core.client.v1.Height.description: Height is a monotonically increasing data type that can be compared against another Height for the purposes of updating and freezing clients Normally the RevisionHeight is incremented at each height while keeping RevisionNumber the same. However some consensus algorithms may choose to reset the height in certain conditions e.g. hard forks, state-machine breaking changes In these cases, the RevisionNumber is incremented so that height continues to be monitonically increasing even as the RevisionHeight gets reset Please note that json tags for generated Go code are overridden to explicitly exclude the omitempty jsontag. This enforces the Go json marshaller to always emit zero values for both revision_number and revision_height.
